**ScannerFlow** is a production-ready, high-fidelity document scanning and digital archiving mobile application for iOS and Android. Built with React Native and Expo, it features advanced image processing, Optical Character Recognition (OCR), and a seamless user experience, all structured under a robust Feature-Sliced Design architecture.

This project serves as a comprehensive blueprint for building scalable, maintainable, and high-performance cross-platform mobile applications using modern best practices and tooling for 2026 standards.

---

---

## âœ¨ Key Features

- **Cross-Platform:** Single codebase for both iOS and Android using React Native & Expo.
- **High-Fidelity Scanning:** Utilizes device camera APIs for sharp, clear document captures.
- **Advanced Image Processing:** Automatic edge detection, perspective correction, and color enhancement filters.
- **OCR Integration:** On-device or cloud-based text recognition to make documents searchable.
- **Digital Archiving:** Securely store and organize scanned documents with metadata and tagging.
- **Modern UX/UI:** A clean, intuitive, and responsive interface built with best practices.
- **Type-Safe Codebase:** 100% TypeScript with strict mode enabled for developer productivity and robustness.

---

## ğŸ›ï¸ Architecture

This project implements **Feature-Sliced Design (FSD)**, a powerful architectural methodology for scaling frontend applications. FSD enforces a strict, modular structure that promotes low coupling, high cohesion, and clear separation of concerns.

sh
ğŸ“‚ src
â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“± app/           # App-wide setup (routing, providers, global styles)
â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“„ pages/         # Entire screens of the app (e.g., HomePage, ScanPage)
â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ§© widgets/       # Composite UI components (e.g., DocumentList, Header)
â”œâ”€â”€ âœ¨ features/      # Business logic features (e.g., document-scan, user-auth)
â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“¦ entities/      # Business entities (e.g., Document, User)
â””â”€â”€ ğŸŒ shared/        # Reusable code (UI kit, APIs, libs, helpers)


This structure ensures that the codebase remains predictable, maintainable, and easy for new developers to onboard.

**Context:** Current Date is **December 2025**. You are building for the 2026 standard.
**Output Standard:** Deliver **EXECUTION-ONLY** results. No plans, no "reporting"â€”only executed code, updated docs, and applied fixes.
**Philosophy:** "Zero-Defect, High-Velocity, Future-Proof."

#### 2. CONTEXT-AWARE APEX TECH STACKS (LATE 2025 STANDARDS)
**Directives:** This repository, `ScannerFlow-Document-Capture-And-Archive-Mobile-App`, is a TypeScript-based mobile application. Apply the corresponding **Apex Toolchain**.

*   **PRIMARY SCENARIO: WEB / APP / GUI (Mobile)**
    *   **Stack:** This project leverages **TypeScript 6.x (Strict)**, **React Native**, and **Expo SDK 52+**. Key tools include **Biome** (for ultra-fast linting and formatting) and **Vitest** (for robust unit and component testing).
    *   **Architecture:** Adheres to **Feature-Sliced Design (FSD)**, ensuring a scalable and maintainable codebase with strict layering and clear module boundaries. This modular monolith approach is ideal for complex mobile applications.
    *   **State Management:** Utilizes a modern state management solution like **Zustand** or **Signals** for efficient, reactive UI updates.
    *   **Native Modules:** Leverages Expo's pre-built native modules and custom development clients for seamless access to device hardware like the camera and file system.
    *   **Verification Commands:**
        *   `npm run lint:check` - Validate code style and quality with Biome.
        *   `npm run typecheck` - Perform static type analysis with `tsc`.
        *   `npm test` - Execute all unit and integration tests with Vitest.

*   **SECONDARY SCENARIO: DATA / AI / SCRIPTS (Python) - *Not applicable for this project's primary function. Reference only for potential future backend services.***
    *   **Stack:** Should any backend services be required, they will use **Python 3.10+**. Key tools will include **uv** (package management), **Ruff** (linting), and **Pytest** (testing), likely within a FastAPI or similar framework.

## ğŸ› ï¸ Tech Stack & Tooling

- **Core Framework:** [React Native](https://reactnative.dev/) & [Expo](https://expo.dev/)
- **Language:** [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/) (Strict Mode)
- **Architecture:** [Feature-Sliced Design (FSD)](https://feature-sliced.design/)
- **Linting & Formatting:** [Biome](https://biomejs.dev/) (Ultra-fast, all-in-one toolchain)
- **Testing:** [Vitest](https://vitest.dev/) for unit & component tests
- **State Management:** [Zustand](https://github.com/pmndrs/zustand) (or similar lightweight solution)
- **Navigation:** [React Navigation](https://reactnavigation.org/)
- **CI/CD:** [GitHub Actions](https://github.com/features/actions)

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- Node.js (LTS version, e.g., 20.x)
- npm or yarn
- Expo CLI: `npm install -g expo-cli`
- Expo Go app on your iOS or Android device

### Installation & Setup

1.  **Clone the repository:**
    bash
    git clone https://github.com/chirag127/ScannerFlow-Document-Capture-And-Archive-Mobile-App.git
    cd ScannerFlow-Document-Capture-And-Archive-Mobile-App
    

2.  **Install dependencies:**
    bash
    npm install
    

3.  **Run the development server:**
    bash
    npx expo start
    

4.  **Scan the QR code** with the Expo Go app on your mobile device to launch the application.

---

## âš™ï¸ Available Scripts

| Script              | Description                                        |
| ------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| `npm start`         | Starts the Expo development server.                |
| `npm run android`   | Runs the app on an Android emulator or device.     |
| `npm run ios`       | Runs the app on an iOS simulator or device.        |
| `npm test`          | Executes unit tests using Vitest.                  |
| `npm run lint`      | Lints and formats the codebase with Biome.         |
| `npm run lint:check`| Checks for linting and formatting errors.          |
| `npm run typecheck` | Runs TypeScript compiler for static type checking. |
